snippet: Ohio is set apart from other states with its large number of provisional ballots and rules about when they may be counted.
abstract: Voting returns in closely contested battleground state of Ohio, with its large number of provisional ballots and rules about when they may be counted, may not become clear until well after Election Day; slim margin between candidates could lead to state's labyrinthine recount procedure that ensures weeks of delay.

byline.contributor: Lizette Alvarez contributed reporting from Miami.

lead_paragraph: Ohio is set apart from other states with its large number of provisional ballots and rules about when they may be counted.

headline.seo: Ohio Law Could Bring Long Delays in a Recount
headline.main: In Case of a Recount, a Long Wait for Ohio
headline.print_headline: In Case of a Recount, A Long Wait for Ohio
